etymologies: early 18th century: from Greek tonos (see tone) + -meter

definitions: a tuning fork or other instrument for measuring the pitch of musical tones.
shortDefinitions: tuning fork or other instrument for measuring pitch of musical tones

definitions: an instrument for measuring the pressure in a part of the body, such as the eyeball (to test for glaucoma) or a blood vessel.
shortDefinitions: instrument for measuring pressure in part of body, such as eyeball to test for glaucoma
